page.title: 10Housing
page.content: In our survey of the two villages we were able to find out that most of both villages have had houses built in the last thirty years.Both villages have an ancient centre of stone cottages as well as quarryworkers 19th century brick cottages.In the 1920s and the 1930s there was some building though not a great deal.After the second world war there was some local authority housing of aspproximately 50 to 60 houses in each village.However most houses were built in the 1960s and the 1970s.These houses vary in size and type.Many of the new homes are detached properties.There are about an equal number of semi's and terraced homes.The majority ,about 80 percent,are owned by the people who live in them.There are about 600 homes in Croft and 900 in Stoney Stanton .
